Hi "maheshsbrmnn",

I think we need much more details about your problem before we're able
to help out.


On 11/26/06, maheshsbrmnn <maheshsbrmnn@...> wrote:
> While running JUnit test cases using AntScript, I am getting the
>  following error:
>
>  junit.framework.AssertionFailed: Timeout Error Occurred.

Could you post the test method that's failing and the full stack trace?


On 11/26/06, maheshsbrmnn <maheshsbrmnn@...> wrote:
>  I have increased timeout in the ant build properties but still getting
>  the same error.

What timeout are you talking about? You specify some kind of a timeout
in a "build.properties" configuration file but how is that value being
used by the Ant script?


On 11/26/06, maheshsbrmnn <maheshsbrmnn@...> wrote:
>   Basically, I am trying to run test suites for my application through
>  JBoss using Antscript Junit task but getting Timeout error Occurred
>  exception.

So which of the two are you doing:
1) Ant script runs JUnit tests (within Ant's JVM) that talk to a JBoss
server over the network.
2) Ant script invokes a webpage on a JBoss server, which in turn runs
JUnit tests (within the server JVM).


On 11/26/06, maheshsbrmnn <maheshsbrmnn@...> wrote:
>  I am sure this is not a timeout issue, but some other error.

Why are you sure it's not a timeout issue?


Lasse
